title: About
text:
Alyssa Counsell received her PhD from York University in 2017 with a focus in quantitative psychology. The following year she joined the Department of Psychology at Toronto Metropolitan University (formerly Ryerson) as an Assistant Professor leading the Psychology and Statistics Education Research (PASER) Lab.
Dr. Counsell is primarily interested in the scholarship of learning and teaching, especially as it pertains to statistics education. She studies topics such as statistics anxiety, attitudes toward statistics and statistical software, and statistics literacy. She also works to identify statistical challenges for applied researchers and explore ways to better emphasize research transparency and credibility. Her research intersects with her passion for teaching statistics, where she has been recognized with several teaching awards for her innovative and inclusive pedagogical approaches.
Dr. Counsell has received over $250,000 of funding from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC) as a Principal Investigator as well as over $1.7 million of funding from the Canadian Institute of Health Research (CIHR) as a collaborator or co-investigator.
To see an up-to-date list of research projects, presentations, and publications, click here for Dr. Counsell’s CV.

title: Statistical Consulting
text:
I run a statistical consulting company called Stats Verify.
Examples of topics for statistical consulting include:

research design
data cleaning
descriptive statistics
univariate statistical methods (e.g., t-test, ANOVA)
multivariate methods (e.g., SEM, HLM, factor analysis)
explanatory or predictive modeling
longitudinal or time series data
power analysis
statistical software

If you’d like to learn more about statistical consulting services, send me an email at a.counsell@torontomu.ca

title: Alyssa Counsell
text:
Hi there!
Welcome to my website! My name is Alyssa Counsell and I am faculty member in the Department of Psychology at Toronto Metropolitan University (formerly Ryerson University).
I lead the Psychology and Statistics Education Research (PASER) Lab.
My program of research focuses on statistics education, statistics anxiety, statistics attitudes, and statistical software.



Current Positions
Associate Professor
Psychology - Toronto Metropolitan University
Teaching Fellow
Centre for Excellence in Learning and Teaching (CELT) - Toronto Metropolitan University
Chair - Teaching of Psychology Section
Canadian Psychological Association
Treasurer - Quantitative Methods Section
Canadian Psychological Association
Associate Editor
Statistics Education Research Journal (SERJ)
Special Interest Group Lead - Statistical Software
Researchers of Statistics Education (RoSE) Network
Chief Statistical Consultant
Stats Verify
